newsitem.title: USA: Intimate Brands, Limited off on news.
newsitem.headline: Intimate Brands, Limited off on news.

text.p: Intimate Brands Inc was off 4-1/8 to 15-7/8 Thursday and its former parent, Limited Inc, was off 2-1/8 to 18, both on news about Intimate Brands' outlook, analysts said. Limited owns about 83 percent of Intimate Brands, which it spun off last year.
Intimate Brands tried to scale back analysts' expectations for the fourth quarter and next year, which affected the stock price of both, McDonald & Co analyst Jeff Stein said.
In a statement, Intimate Brands projected earnings growth lower than Wall Street had expected and said it sees flat sales in 1997 for its Victoria's Secret catalog business.
Stein said he thinks the lower Intimate Brands price makes the stock "appropriately valued."
But Lazard Freres analyst Todd D. Slater said the market overreacted to the company's more conservative projections.

"I think the company has made some very realistic, achievable projections, and I salute them for doing this even though they knew it would affect the stock price," said Slater, who continues to rate the stock a buy.
NatWest Securities analyst Bob Buchanan said a number of retail stocks were off on Thursday.
